PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Summer Internship at Bhabha Atomic Research Centre(BARC)
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
The aim of the project was to develop a novel data transport mechanism for a host based intrusion detection system (HIDS) using a broker to mediate all communications between the central server and the hosts. 
The implementation of the project was done in Python on a Linux platform. PostgreSQL server was used for data storage. WSGI compatible scripts were written for the Broker machine which were executed when an HTTPS request was sent by the Central Server or the Hosts.

The following features were implemented:-
1. Two mechanisms (called the push mode and pull mode) were implemented for transport.
2. A configuration manager with a CLI that can be used to configure the various hosts from the Central Server.
3. An authentication module for this transport mechanism.
4. A provision for multiple subscribers (central servers) to monitor the hosts.
5. An Installation package (for Linux) was made so that any component (Central Server, Broker or Host) can be deployed on a machine. More than one component can be installed on the same machine.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Development of an SDN Aware TCP Module
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: The Linux TCP retransmission and congestion control modules were modified so as to collect information regarding network traffic and speed precisely from an SDN controller and use it to set packet transmission rates.

Was the team lead for this project. It won the second prize in the category Health and Nutrition presented at APOGEE 2014, BITS Pilani.
Aim of the project was to provide a facility for the users to manage their diet intake and get a feedback on the quality of their diet, nutrients which they are deficient in and further suggestions about improvement of their daily intake.

The program stores the daily intake of the user as well as the menu of the mess where he eats. This food is compared against a global database of food item vs nutrients to calculate the nutrient intake of the user.
This intake is compared against standards and the right food items to be consumed are suggested based on the mess menu.
The program is platform independent, and has an intuitive UI.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Parallelization of TFIDF Based File Indexing
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
From a large set of files, an index of term-to-files was created.
This indexing was done in multiple phases, each phase being parallelized at both a fine grained (multi-core) and a coarse grained (cluster) level.

A software to predict disease outbreak using web search trends in a city or a country was developed.
It could also predict where the disease could spread to, taking into account population density, migration rates, neighborhood, healthcare index etc.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Predicting Heart Disease using Active Learning Techniques
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: An active learning model was developed that could accurately predict whether a person is suffering from coronary heart disease using a dataset that is largely unlabelled, based on relevant parameters such as cholesterol levels, heart rate, age etc.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Design of In-memory Hash Join Algorithms for Distributed Multicore Systems
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Radix partitioning and no partitioning hash join algorithms (which were originally designed for multicore systems) were modified and implemented on a cluster with multicore CPUs.
Relative performance of these algorithms on both architectures was compared.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: A Comparative Study On Automated Speaker Recognition
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
The task of speaker recognition was accomplished using three machine learning techniques, namely vector quantization, gaussian mixture models and KNN and a thorough analysis of their relative performance was done.
Features were extracted from the analog input in the form of MFCCs.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Design of a Language and Compiler for Complex Numbers
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
A language was designed to specifically support complex number operations.
A compiler for the language was designed in C from scratch.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Automated Formalization of Smart Meter Security Analysis
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
A tool that could formalize an abstract model of an embedded system in rewriting logic was developed so that its security analysis can be automated.For this project the focus was specifically on smart meters.
A model of the system in UML is taken as input and the corresponding code in Maude (which is a system and language based on rewrite logic) is generated.Vulnerability searches on this code can now be automated.
